solution: First we factor each of these numbers: \[\sqrt{3\cdot6\cdot10\cdot15\cdot21\cdot28}=\sqrt{3\cdot(3\cdot2)(2\cdot5)(5\cdot3)(3\cdot7)(7\cdot4)}.\]Next we notice that this expression contains a lot of squares, so is equal to  \[\sqrt{3^2\cdot2^2\cdot5^2\cdot3^2\cdot7^2\cdot2^2}.\]Since the square root of a product is the product of the square roots this is equal to  \[\sqrt{3^2}\cdot\sqrt{2^2}\cdot\sqrt{5^2}\cdot\sqrt{3^2}\cdot\sqrt{7^2}\cdot\sqrt{2^2}=3\cdot2\cdot5\cdot3\cdot7\cdot2.\]Multiplying this out gives \[3\cdot2\cdot5\cdot3\cdot7\cdot2=3\cdot10\cdot21\cdot2=\boxed{1260}.\]
model_solution:
## Step 1: Identify the prime factors in the given expression
$3\cdot6\cdot10\cdot15\cdot21\cdot28$ can be broken down into prime factors: $3, 2\cdot3, 2\cdot5, 3\cdot5, 3\cdot7, 2^2\cdot7$.

## Step 2: Group the prime factors into pairs
Group the prime factors into pairs of identical factors: $2\cdot2, 2\cdot3, 2\cdot5, 3\cdot3, 5\cdot7, 7\cdot7$.

## Step 3: Simplify the product of the pairs
Combine the pairs into a simplified product: $2^2\cdot(3^2)\cdot(5\cdot7^2)$.

## Step 4: Express the simplified product as a numerical value
$2^2\cdot(3^2)\cdot(5\cdot7^2) = 4\cdot(9)\cdot(35)$.

## Step 5: Calculate the numerical value
$4\cdot(9)\cdot(35) = 4\cdot
## Step 6: $\sqrt{4\cdot9\cdot35}=\sqrt{(2^2)\cdot(3^2)\cdot(5\cdot7^2)}$
$=\sqrt{(2^2)\cdot(3^2)\cdot7^2\cdot5}$
$=\sqrt{(2\cdot3\cdot7^2)^2\cdot5}$
$=5\cdot(2\cdot3\cdot7^2)=5\cdot(2\cdot3\cdot49)$
## Step 7: Calculate the numerical value
$5\cdot(2\cdot3\cdot49)=5\cdot(6\cdot49)$
## Step 8: Calculate the numerical value
$5\cdot(6\cdot49)=5\cdot294$
## Step 9: Calculate the numerical value
$5\cdot294=1470$
## Step 10: $\sqrt{1470}$
$=\sqrt{2\cdot3\cdot5\cdot7^2\cdot2\cdot3\cdot5\cdot7}$
$=\sqrt{(2^2)\cdot(3^2)\cdot7^2\cdot5^2}$
$=7\cdot5\cdot3\cdot2$
$=210$
## Step 11: $\sqrt{2\cdot3\cdot5\cdot7^2\cdot2\cdot3\cdot5\cdot7}$
$=\sqrt{(2^2)\cdot(3^2)\cdot7^2\cdot5^2}$
$=7\cdot5\cdot3\cdot2$
$=210$
## Step 12: $= 7\cdot5\cdot3\cdot2 = 210$
$=7\cdot5\cdot3\cdot2$
## Step 13: $= 7\cdot5\cdot3\cdot2 = 210$

full_steps:
## Step 1: Identify the prime factors in the given expression
$3\cdot6\cdot10\cdot15\cdot21\cdot28$ can be broken down into prime factors: $3, 2\cdot3, 2\cdot5, 3\cdot5, 3\cdot7, 2^2\cdot7$.

## Step 2: Group the prime factors into pairs
Group the prime factors into pairs of identical factors: $2\cdot2, 2\cdot3, 2\cdot5, 3\cdot3, 5\cdot7, 7\cdot7$.

## Step 3: Simplify the product of the pairs
Combine the pairs into a simplified product: $2^2\cdot(3^2)\cdot(5\cdot7^2)$.

## Step 4: Express the simplified product as a numerical value
$2^2\cdot(3^2)\cdot(5\cdot7^2) = 4\cdot(9)\cdot(35)$.

## Step 5: Calculate the numerical value
$4\cdot(9)\cdot(35) = 4\cdot
